title: Problems since 6.17 patch
body:
I'm currently having problems with the current patch as well. I experiencing the issue where the launcher will sit at 1 file scanned, 0%, and after a few moments the "Unspecified error" message will pop up.

I have researched extensively to try and find a solution. I have been through every suggestion on the help forums, I have disabled any firewall/antivirus I have, reset my ISP/DNS/modem, disabled UAC, tried the repair option, the Hextech repair tool, clean installation, heck, I have even messed around with my Windows updates to see if that was causing the issue. From what I have been able to research, something with the latest Windows 10 update seems to be interfering? I have tried countless things to try and fix this issue, or even make some headway, but no matter what I attempt, I'm always left with my launcher displaying the "Unspecified Error" message, usually followed not long after by a bugsplat error.

I opened a ticket over two ago, and have heard no response or anything on the matter, and I'm rather frustrated. If there is an issue, I can understand, but being left in the dark is what is infuriating. Not to mention a different post claimed that this issue was 100% resolved in NA, yet I continue to experience the issue. I have no idea what to do or what to try anymore.

replies.body:
We've been pretty slammed with tickets lately, so there's a bit of a delay in us getting back to you. Our tech team is hitting their ticket queue pretty hard and will  reach out to you as soon as possible. Additionally, please avoid "bumping" your ticket, as it will put yours back to the end of the queue and lengthen the time it takes for us to get to you.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Just so I'm aware, how does a person "bump" their ticket? 

And thank you for the response :)

"Bumping" is the act of replying to your request/ticket before someone has had a chance to grab it and reply back to you. 

I hope that cleared it up for you!
